name: Eugene Y. Vasserman
content: Eugene Y. Vasserman's home at KSU Eugene Y. Vasserman ÐÐµÐ½Ñ ÐÐ°ÑÑÐµÑÐ¼Ð°Ð½ å´é¨æ´¥ Associate Professor, Department of Computer Science Director, Center for Cybersecurity and Trustworthy Systems Kansas State University Email: eyv  |@|  ksu  (...)  edu Office: 2171 Engineering Hall Office hours (Fall 2025): Tuesdays 2:30 pm – 4:00 pm and Wednesdays 11:30 am – 1:00 pm or by appointment (A clarification on the nature of "office hours" [PDF] (external resource)) Quick links: Publications | Teaching | Lab/Students | Projects | About me Student research Although I don't necessarily have open paid research positions right now, I'm always looking for bright and motivated graduate and undergraduate students who share my research interests or just want to learn more about security. If you are already at KSU then email me, schedule a meeting, or just stop by my office. Tell me about yourself, your experience with security, and what you might enjoy working on. If you aren't at KSU then I would encourage you to apply and indicate an interest in computer and information security. (While I try to answer all emails, I don't always get the chance.) A way to make yourself stand out in a good way is to have specific questions, comments, or suggestions regarding security research or papers. A way to make yourself stand out in a bad way is to ask questions to which you can easily find the answer yourself. Some of my own research interests Network and distributed system security Privacy and anonymity Censorship resistance Operating system security Medical and IoT security Usable security Applied cryptography Systems and Network Security (SyNeSec) Lab I have the privilege of working with a number of bright and talented students: Current: Ke Dong Sahar Ghorbani Matthew Kelley Graduate alumni: Qais Tasali, PhD, 2020.  Dissertation: "Authorization in interoperable medical systems."  After graduation: Paycom Chandan Chowdhury, MS, 2019.  Thesis: "Finding malicious usage via capture, storage, analysis and visualization of DNS packets."  After graduation: Corelight Matt Webb, MS, 2018.  Thesis: "Evaluating tool based automated malware analysis through persistence mechanism detection."  After graduation: Sandia National Labs Hong Liu, PhD, 2017.  Dissertation: "Black-, grey-, and white-box side-channel programming for software integrity checking." Sajid Rahman, MS, 2017.  Report: "An empirical case study on Stack Overflow to explore developers' security challenges."  After graduation: University of Florida Institute of Cybersecurity Zainab Ruhwanya, MS, 2015.  Thesis: "Attitudes toward, and awareness of, online privacy and security: A quantitative comparison of East Africa and U.S. internet users."  After graduation: University of Cape Town Scott Bell, PhD, 2014.  Dissertation: "Low overhead methods for improving education capacity and outcomes in computer science."  After graduation: Northwest Missouri State University Kevin Dean, MS, 2014.  Thesis: "TrustVoucher: Automating trust in websites."  After graduation: Xpanxion Carlos Salazar, MS, 2014.  Thesis: "A security architecture for medical application platforms."  After graduation: Cerner Jayson Sharp, MS, 2014.  Thesis: "A logging service as a universal subscriber."  After graduation: Microsoft Keith McVey, MS, 2014.  Thesis: "Modeling vulnerabilities in
